metadata.title: Commands
metadata.description: Consul is controlled via a very easy to use command-line interface (CLI). Consul is only a single command-line application: `consul`. This application then takes a subcommand such as agent or members. The complete list of subcommands is in the navigation to the left.

layout.name: docs-root-landing
layout.subtitle: Consul is controlled via a very easy to use command-line interface (CLI). Consul is only a single command-line application: `consul`. This application then takes a subcommand such as agent or members. The complete list of subcommands is in the navigation to the left.

mdxSource.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={};const MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components,...props}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...props,components:components,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Consul is controlled via a very easy to use command-line interface (CLI).
Consul is only a single command-line application: `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`consul`),`. This application
then takes a subcommand such as "agent" or "members". The complete list of
subcommands is in the navigation to the left.`),mdx("p",null,`The `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`consul`),` CLI is a well-behaved command line application. In erroneous
cases, a non-zero exit status will be returned. It also responds to `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`-h`),` and `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`--help`),`
as you'd most likely expect. And some commands that expect input accept
"-" as a parameter to tell Consul to read the input from stdin.`),mdx("p",null,`To view a list of the available commands at any time, just run `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`consul`),` with
no arguments:`),mdx("pre",{"style":{"backgroundColor":"var(--hds-code-block-color-surface-primary)","color":"var(--hds-code-block-color-token)"},"tabindex":"0","language":"shellsession","className":"language-shellsession"},mdx("code",{parentName:"pre","className":"language-shellsession"},mdx("span",{parentName:"code","className":"line"},mdx("span",{parentName:"span","style":{"color":"var(--hds-code-block-color-cyan)"}},`$`),mdx("span",{parentName:"span","style":{"color":"var(--hds-code-block-color-token)"}},` consul`)),`

gRPC listener will require TLS and present the same certificate as the https
listener. As with `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`CONSUL_HTTP_ADDR`),`, if TLS is enabled either the `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`https://`),`
scheme should be used, or `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`CONSUL_HTTP_SSL`),` set.`),mdx("h3",{"id":"consul_namespace"},mdx("a",{parentName:"h3","className":"__permalink-h","href":"#consul_namespace","aria-label":"consul_namespace permalink"},`\xbb`),mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"h3"},`CONSUL_NAMESPACE`)),mdx("p",null,mdx("strong",{parentName:"p"},`Enterprise only`),`
If you're using Consul Enterprise namespaces you can set this for the CLI to
explicitly use a single namespace. This is common across all Hashicorp
products that support Enterprise namespaces.`),mdx("pre",null,mdx("code",{parentName:"pre"},`CONSUL_NAMESPACE=default
`)))};MDXContent.isMDXComponent=true;

metadata.title: Consul by HashiCorp
metadata.description: Consul is a service networking solution to automate network configurations, discover services, and enable secure connectivity across any cloud or runtime.
